item.title: Comment on France, and the United States by mento
item.description:
Most of France 's electricity is low carbon ~ 40 g CO2 KWh . In comparison the US is ~ 380 g CO2 / KWh, so this doesn't make much sense.

Cancel the Olympics and tourism if the CO2 is concern has reached this high a level

item.title: Comment on Saturday assorted links by Crusader
item.description:
7. Lots of people, totally bipartisan, think that supermarkets and retail stores are gushing cash and profiteering off of inflation.

If you take 10 seconds to look at net margins of any large retailer it’s pretty depressing

Walmart 1.94%
CVS 1.7% ish
Kroger 1.44%

So even if you nationalized these or made them non profits, you’d at most be saving like 2%. So just to clarify, making Krogers a non profit has less of an impact on savings than using your 6% cashback grocery card.

And that’s assuming they’d be run as efficiently. I’m sure if the DMV was running Kroger you’d end up paying 30% more and somehow they’d be cashflow negative.

Comment URL: https://marginalrevolution.com/marginalrevolution/2024/06/saturday-assorted-links-463.html?commentID=160771787
